definitions.definition: A white or gray/grey crystalline salt, with a slight alkaline taste, used as a flux , in soldering metals, making enamels , fixing colors/colours on porcelain , and as a soap, etc.
The sodium salt of boric acid , Na 2 B 4 O 7 , either anhydrous or with 5 or 10 molecules of water of crystallization ; sodium tetraborate .
Cheap or tawdry furniture or other works of industrial design.

main_definition: A white or gray/grey crystalline salt, with a slight alkaline taste, used as a flux , in soldering metals, making enamels , fixing colors/colours on porcelain , and as a soap, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( inorganic chemistry ) The sodium salt of boric acid , Na 2 B 4 O 7 , either anhydrous or with 5 or 10 molecules of water of crystallization ; sodium tetraborate .
( sometimes attributive ) Cheap or tawdry furniture or other works of industrial design.
